core_roles.description: The entity performing the cutting action.
The tool used to perform the cutting.
core_roles.example: The cook cuts the onion with a knife.

peripheral_roles.description: The initial location or configuration of the object before cutting.
peripheral_roles.example: The cook cuts the onion from the basket.

peripheral_roles.description: The end state or result of the cutting action.
peripheral_roles.example: The onion is cut into slices.
The cook cuts the onion carefully.

peripheral_roles.description: The location where the cutting occurs.
peripheral_roles.example: The cook cuts the onion on the cutting board.
The cook cuts the onion in the morning.

peripheral_roles.description: The extent or degree of the cutting action.
peripheral_roles.example: The onion is cut halfway through.

additional_roles.description: The reason or motivation for the cutting action.
additional_roles.example: The cook cuts the onion to prepare a salad.

additional_roles.description: The outcome or product of the cutting action.
additional_roles.example: The cook cuts the onion into fine slices.

additional_roles.description: A secondary entity assisting in the cutting action.
additional_roles.example: The chef and the assistant cut the vegetables together.
